question: The electronic configuration of X and Y are given below:
X: 1s² 2s² 2p⁶ 3s² 3p³
Y: 1s² 2s² 2p⁶ 3s² 3p⁵
Which of the following is the correct molecular formula and type of bond formed between X and Y?
explanation: X is Phosphorus (P, valence 3/5) and Y is Chlorine (Cl, valence 1). They form PCl3 (XY3) or PCl5. The bond formed between two non-metals is covalent [cite: 513-527].
